event.title: BLOC
event.description:
Back for a third glorious year, the BLOC electronic music festival is a byword for credibility in the UK festival scene.

Neatly sidestepping the calamities of the English weather, BLOC is held indoors on a holiday resort on the west coast. Everyone attending gets their own apartment for the weekend included in the ticket price, which makes for a whole village of after-parties once the main venues close down.

Previous headliners include Autechre, Surgeon, Luke Slater, Robert Hood, Karl Bartos, A Guy Called Gerald and Amon Tobin.



BLOC 2009

event.title: Wifey Takeover! Bristol
event.description:
WIFEY 29 November 2008
Bassline/niche/4x4/2step

BRISTOL TAKEOVER
Chester's, Frogmore Street, BS1 5UX

Wifey is all about bringing the cutting edge of the bassline sound to London, except this time we're taking it to Bristol, with help from our friends at the Frijsfo label. Chester's is a new venue with 250 capacity and a heavy Funktion 1 rig.

Line-up:

Dexplicit (DXP label boss and one of the best for sure, smashed up our last one in London)
http://www.myspace.com/dexplicit

DJ Undecided (The Northern Line label's resident CDJ killer, another favourite from past Wifeys)
http://www.myspace.com/djundecided

Blazey (Subloaded and H.E.N.C.H. man representing the home team)
http://www.myspace.com/thedjblazey

Hot City (Resident production talent, blending 2-step, vintage house and rave)
http://www.myspace.com/hotcitybass

Oslek (The man behind Bristol label Frijsfo, making this happen)
http://www.myspace.com/frijsfobeats

Love's Tru Flavour
Hard Target

http://www.myspace.com/londonwifey

2200-0600
£5

event.title: The Garden
event.description:
The Garden is a new, free, monthly-ish party hosted by the Cocadisco guys that takes place in a lovely old pub on Victoria Park Road called the Britannia, which has a huge garden that backs on to the park. The pub is off the beaten track, far enough from the hordes of Hoxton, but still accessible to all.

We're focusing on tropical electronics, Italo-disco, synth-pop and smudgy house. It's going to be pretty special. The night runs from 9 PM to 2 AM and it's free to get in.

The first one is this Friday, October 24, and we're thrilled that the star attraction is none other than Swedish producer JOHAN AGEBJÖRN, who'll be making his UK debut. He is the composer/producer of those beautiful SALLY SHAPIRO records like 'Disco Romance', and has just released an incredible solo album of ambient electronics, 'Mossebo'. He is also playing the following evening in Nottingham, so it's kind of a mini UK tour.

Please note: this will be Johan's first DJ performance in the UK and is a must for lovers of fine pop music everywhere.

Johan has released music for Diskokaine, Permanent Vacation, Lo Recordings, Klein and Smalltown Supersound, and recently remixed Lindstrom.

Also appearing on the night are the Dissident label's hottest new recruit, the Off Key Hat, and Cocadisco's Piers and Rodaidh.

Location: http://www.streetmap.co.uk/newmap.srf?x=535994&y=184085&z=0&sv=E9+7BT&st=2&pc=E9+7BT&mapp=newmap.srf&searchp=newsearch.srf

Johan's website is http://www.johanagebjorn.info/

Here's some links about how amazing Johan is:

http://anthemmagazine.com/story/925
http://www.starsend.org/Mossebo.html
http://www.sonicimmersion.org/review.php?letter=A&review=71651
http://goatsend.blogspot.com/2008/10/johan-agebjorn-featuring-lisa-
barra.html
http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/soundboard/2008/09/sally-shapiro-p.html
http://www.pitchforkmedia.com/article/download/145486

Some reviews in Swedish:
http://www.gp.se/gp/jsp/Crosslink.jsp?d=208&a=450402
http://www.groove.se/site/recension.asp?recId=2702&mediumId=1

And two interviews, one in English and one in Swedish:
http://www.sonicimmersion.org/interview.php?letter=A&interview=90701
http://www.digfi.com/default.aspx?id=12043

Finally, here are two unofficial videos to "Spacer Woman From Mars"
and "Deeper Space Woman" by Iris B Cegarra:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FizsJ0OVCpE
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yNH6fQpfNfE

event.title: Overlap.org presents...
event.description:
Times : 8pm

Tickets : £6/ £5

SEBASTIEN ROUX
Coming from the experimental electronic music scene, Sébastien Roux has played in Europe, Australia and United States. He has been invited by several festivals like Musique Action (Nancy) Nuit d’hiver (Marseille), Netmage (Bologna), Whynote (Dijon), Présence Electronique (Paris), J’en Rêve (Fondation Cartier Paris), Musica (Strasbourg), Net Days (Bruxelles), Santarcangelo (Italy). In 2006, he had a residency in the studios of La Muse en Circuit to work on his piece Oblique, for cello and electronics (premiere: “Extension du domaine de la note” festival/Paris) He also spent a 15 days residency at the school of fine arts of Nice (Villa Arson) with Eddie Ladoire to work on a radio piece project. He worked with French sound artist Vincent Epplay, on Klavier integral, a piece commissioned by GRM. He also got commissioned a soundtrack for French archives of the 20th century architecture by the Museum of contemporary art of Vitry. In 2005, he worked on an improvised music project with drummer Leonzio Cherubini and viola player Garth Knox. Since 2003, he has been working as musical assistant at IRCAM, where he mainly collaborates with composer Georges Aperghis (Avis de Tempête, Happy End, Dans le mur). He has been awarded for the sixth international radio art contest, organized by la Muse en Circuit.
His work is released by the labels apestaartje, 12k, Carpark and Room 40, and by n-rec and optical sound for the heller project.
http://www.myspace.com/sebastienrouxmusic

" Sébastien Roux is one of the most interesting musician of the French electronic scene : his contemporary music culture, and his pop music culture allow him to compose a very evocative music, mixing electronics and organic with smartness and feelings – like Fennesz or Mitchell Akiyama.. Sébastien Roux is an inquiring musician, ready for every kind of collaborations : opera with Aperghis, minimal electronics with Heller, Pop and Musique Concrète with Greg Davis" (Paquet surprise, released on Carpark). DAVID SANSON www.mouvement.net

DOUGLAS BENFORD
Douglas Benford has been making his digital music, mainly under the moniker of SI-CUT.DB, for almost two decades, releasing many albums in differing guises. He has collaborated with Stephan Mathieu, Rechenzentrum, and Ben Edwards [as 'Tennis'] amongst others, with music available on labels such as Fällt, Bip Hop, Highpoint Lowlife, BackGround, Warp, Mutek and 12K. His latest album 'In The Footsteps Of The Princess' will be released on the 12x50 label. Benford has performed at festivals internationally (Mutek, Transmediale, Synch etc) and also arts venues such as Tate Modern and the ICA in London. He is also co-curator of Sprawl experimental music events with Iris Garrelfs, since 1996.
http://www.douglasbenford.co.uk
http://blog.myspace.com/sicutdb


BEDDOES
Beddoes is Blase Roccisano. Orginally from Melbourne, Australianow residing in London. Beddoes performances are rare and very beautiful. Incorporating live acoustic guitars and the processing of sounds & field recordings via computer. In the past Blase has collaborated with sound artists Joel Stern, Tom Morris, has played in the trio Hood/Roccisano/Rodgers (Paul Hood and Michael Rodgers) and worked with video artist Antuong Nguyen.
www.beddoesmusic.com

Kultureflash preview -
http://kultureflash.net/current/#event5695

advance tickets
http://www.wegottickets.com/event/36952

event.description:

<a class="clickthrutop" href="http://ad.doubleclick.net/clk;208443991;29779986;k?http://clk.atdmt.com/TOM/go/115204933/direct/01/"; target="_blank"></a>



<div id="description">



<h1>Rafael Lozano-Hemmer</h1><br />
<h1 style="color:#666; font-style:italic;">Frequency and Volume</h1><br />
<h1 style="font-weight:normal;">9 October 2008 - 18 January 2009<br />
The Curve</h1>



<p class="freeadmission">
<strong>Tickets:</strong> Admission Free<br />
<span style="font-size:10px; color:#666666;">subject to availability</span>
</p>

<p>
<li style="margin:0 0 10px 0;"><strong>Description</strong></li>

<span style="font-size:12px;"><p style="padding:0 0 10px 0; line-height:20px;">Become a human antenna and determine the tuning of 48 radios in a new interactive exhibition in The Curve. This immersive work investigates London’s contested radio space and literally turns visitors’ bodies into antennae.</p>

<p style="padding:0 0 10px 0; line-height:20px;">Working at the crossroads between architecture, sculpture and performance, the Mexico-born, Canada-based artist <strong>Rafael Lozano-Hemmer</strong> is well known for developing large-scale installations in public spaces. His work encourages both social interaction and audience participation through the deployment of new technologies.</p>
<p style="padding:0 0 10px 0;">For his first solo UK exhibition in a public gallery, Lozano-Hemmer transforms The Curve into a giant interactive environment. <i>Frequency and Volume</i> is composed of 48 radios, which can potentially all be tuned to different channels simultaneously. The 90-metre long arc of the gallery wall becomes a visual and sonic representation of London’s radio spectrum, constantly changing according to the physical position of its visitors.   The resulting sound environment is a continuously evolving composition created by multiple contributors.</p>
For more information on the exhibition, <a href="http://ad.doubleclick.net/clk;208443991;29779986;k?http://clk.atdmt.com/TOM/go/115204933/direct/01/9"; target="_blank">click here</a>.</span>
</p>
</div>

event.title: Concrete and Glass
event.description:
Concrete and Glass - A new music and art festival for East London 2nd / 3rd October 2008.

Concrete and Glass, an innovative music and contemporary art event will take over 30 alternative-site exhibitions, 18 music venues, and numerous local gallery spaces in the renowned creative cauldron of London’s Shoreditch on Thursday 2nd & Friday 3rd of October by bringing together the cream of new, original and established bands and artists.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Concrete and Glass, new in 2008, takes place on Thursday 2nd and Friday 3rd October 2008 in over 20 established music venues and galleries in the Shoreditch, Hoxton and Brick Lane areas of East London.

Each venue will play host to the best performances and events by new, upcoming and some established bands and artists. All venues are within a short walk of each other, with capacities varying between 150 and 750 people. The music features over 100 bands in 18 venues.

The first acts confirmed so far include TV On The Radio, Kimmo Pohjonen, James Holden, Telepathe, Beyond The Wizards Sleeve, Euros Childs, Eat Your Own Ears, Telepathe, Errors, Steve Lamacq, Pete And The Pirates, and Apes & Androids. For the line-up details as available please click here.

Plus art exhibitions from A Foundation, Flora Fairbairn Projects, Gerry Fox, Mark Neville, Saatchi Online, Riflemaker, Artprojx's David Blandy And Manasseh Sound System.

Wristbands will gain you entry to all 'Concrete and Glass' art and music venues subject to capacity. Single and two day wristbands are available priced at £35 for both days or £22.50 for either Thursday or Friday.

event.title: Approximately Infinite Universe
event.description:
Two of the UK’s busiest leftfield promoters, NO-FI and [NO.SIGNAL] join forces this September to present APPROXIMATELY INFINITE UNIVERSE - A CARAVAN OF RAW SOUND MAGIC FROM FINLAND AND THE US, an eight-date tour, supported by CMN and media sponsored by The Wire Magazine, which will travel the length of the UK. Featuring special commissions and unique collaborations from some of the most innovative and exciting acts of Finland’s underground with the haunting ISLAJA, the beautifully disorientating KEMIALLISET YSTÄVÄT, the epiphanies of ES and the genius collages of TOMUNTONTTU (Jan Anderzén) - most represented by the influential and exploratory label FONAL. Each will musically entangle themselves amongst an uncompromising host of Americans, including the home-recorded acid folk of FURSAXA; freak goddess SAMARA LUBELSKI (Hall Of Fame, Tower recordings, MV&EE), the ‘Terry Riley-fused with Kate Bush’ impossibility of AXOLOTL, the ‘coal-powered spacecraft from some steampunk parallel universe’ that is BLEVIN BLECTUM and the occult trance duo SKATERS.

Each performance will be a unique and brand new collaboration, each of the Finnish acts inviting a US counterpart to collaborate on a performance, highlighting the parallels in strands of the recent evolving trend of ‘weird/avant folk/noise’ between the US under the layer communities and Finland’s northern circles.

The performances will be made of material composed in the months leading up to the tour and worked in 2 days rehearsal. The concerts will take the form of two acts with the 4 groupings rotating during each act.

NO-FI and [NO.SIGNAL] - in conjunction with the artists themselves - designed this approach as a way of taking the aforementioned trans-Atlantic influence exchange, trapping it in a vacuum and making it feedback on itself in order create a whole family of brand new musical beasts.

Selected dates on this tour will feature an exclusive screenings curated by FONAL-founder Sami Sänpäkkilä and a selection of commissioned work which will take place before live performances. The concerts will be recorded and later released as digital only compilations .

event.title: Pat And Trevor Presents
event.description:
JANEK SCHAEFER – Solo Concert [on stage early evening]

Janek Schaefer is a world-renowned sound artist, musician and composer. His evocatively woven soundscapes combine abstract electro-acoustic source material with long forgotten vinyl alterations. Janek will be heading up a night of experimental fun and full on party vibes. His first event of the evening will be a 30-minute performance with his collection of found sounds, manipulated vinyl and drones drones drones.

Janek was nominated for the British Composer of the Year awards in 2007.


YURI SUZUKI

Yuri Suzuki is a Japanese product designer and electronic musician, graduating from the Royal College of Art in 2008 with a set of fascinating and fun sound toys, like 'Sound Chaser' – a train track made from old slices of vinyl. Yuri explores the enchanting space between sound, image and touch in both a poetic and practical way. Expect a heavy mix of sound toys, made up beats and blurred arms.


HELM

Helm (aka Luke Younger) is one half of the duo Birds of Delay, and has released a number of highly textured and intense sound compositions through the medium of CDR.

Helm had his live debut back in July supporting the great Oren Ambarchi, and is fresh back from Brighton's free noise fest "colour out of space", where he shared the bill with Thurston Moore (Sonic Youth), Chris Corsano and The Skaters.


DJ DEDICATION

This is the antithesis to Janek's 'serious' side. DJ Dedication is armed with a box load of cracking party tunes and other obscure 7" vinyl with effects pedals, costume, mic and a massive attitude. DJ Dedication asks you what records you want to hear, and then dedicates them. A good old-fashioned floor filler.

"You are the best DJ in the world" [Masked Ball, Sept 2008, London]


DAVE THE RAVE

Dave The Rave is Janek's best friend and vintage synthesizer fetishist. They used to DJ together at the RCA bar. This is his debut gig, sparring with DJ Dedication. One shall have to wait and see.

The Sassoon Gallery is situated underneath Peckham Rye Railway Station in a railway arch. It can be clearly identified by its large glass front, which is visible from Platform 2.

event.title: london headphone festival 2008
event.description:
Think of a festival in reverse … the London Headphone Festival is back with two sessions of headphones-only listening. Now in our fifth year, we leave our spiritual home off Brick Lane for two new venues. On 20 September we take over beautifully restored warehouse space Café Oto in Dalston for an all-day listening session. On 24 October, we move on to the legendary underground space Shunt, deep under London Bridge, as part of the 4-day NetAudio festival.

Placard flips the concept of a traditional festival: instead of a PA we provide massed banks of headphone splitters. The audience plugs in and tunes in. For once, it’s the chance for some focused listening.

Confirmed artists include: Family Battlesnake, Joachim Nordwall, Pausal, Mandelbrot, slub, Cormac Heron, Brassica, Philip Julian, Cacao, Birds Of Delay, Bleeding Heart Narrative, The Noiser, Simpson brothers, Ryan Jordan, London Concrete, Yee-King, Spoonfight, Dylan Bates, Brandy Alexander Project, Rob Munro and Meat Sweats. More TBC.

Past artists have included Hot Chip, David Toop, Janek Schaefer, Leafcutter John, Adem, Max Eastley, Sanso-Xtro, Jem Finer, Icarus, Main and Colin Potter.

Both venues are fully licensed, and there will be food, merchandise and other bits and pieces. Please bring your own headphones!

Praise and bafflement for previous festivals:

“A far cry from Glastonbury or Reading” — New Statesman
“Ludicrously straightfaced” — The Guardian
“Freebie of the week” — Time Out
“One of the highlights of a long hot summer” — The Wire
“The only way to understand the most communal musical gathering is to come along and plug in” — Kultureflash

Brought to you by area10 media lab / highpointlowlife / it is whatever / [no.signal] / slow sound system / openlab / yaxu.

-----------

Details

Session 1
When: 20 September, 1pm-11pm Where: Café Oto, 18-22 Ashwin St, E8 3DL. info@cafeoto.co.uk Cost: free, £2 suggested donation Map: http://tinyurl.com/6hcdv7

Session 2
When: 24 October / 7-11pm Where: Shunt, 20 Stainer St, SE1 9RL. events@shunt.co.uk Cost: £10 Map:[url= http://tinyurl.com/5cxry9] http://tinyurl.com/5cxry9

Please bring your own headphones! Quarter inch headphone adaptors will be available for rent

-----------

Contact

London Placard: http://london.leplacard.org
International Placard site: http://leplacard.org/
NetAudio festival - http://2008.netaudiolondon.cc/festival
Café Oto – http://www.cafeoto.co.uk
Shunt - http://www.shunt.co.uk

-----------

About the Placard Headphone Festival

Le Placard started in 1998 in Paris, France. At that time finding venues for alternative music was difficult, and police raids on unlicensed events were frequent. So instead Erik Minkkinen organised a headphone party in his small apartment, called ‘placard’ after the French word for ‘cupboard’.

Since then this concept has grown to an international streaming festival, with tens of cities providing listening rooms for local and remote performances. Placard has formed part of the Mutek, Transmediale, Garage and Pixelache festivals. The event in Paris has itself grown into an institution, running for 72 hours straight where the audience sleep with their headphones on, still listening.

event.title: Approximately Infinite Universe
event.description:
Two of the UK’s busiest leftfield promoters, NO-FI and [NO.SIGNAL] join forces this September to present APPROXIMATELY INFINITE UNIVERSE - A CARAVAN OF RAW SOUND MAGIC FROM FINLAND AND THE US, an eight-date tour, supported by CMN and media sponsored by The Wire Magazine, which will travel the length of the UK. event.title: Rock-a-Rolla & Last.fm/Presents
event.description:
<style type="text/css">

{

<a href="http://www.last.fm/presents"; class="clickthrutop"></a>

<!-- copy needs links-->
<p class="festivalink">





<a href="http://www.rock-a-rolla.com/">Rock-A-Rolla magazine</a> have hooked up with <a href="http://www.last.fm/presents/">Last.fm/Presents</a>; to bring you a night of the most exciting music on the planet today! We are extremely delighted to announce that the legendary <a href="/music/Secret+Chiefs+3">Secret Chiefs 3</a> will be making their first ever UK appearance, headed by <a href="/music/Trey+Spruance">Trey Spruance</a> (Ex Faith No More / Mr Bungle). Also on the bill are the incredible <a href="/music/Zu">Zu</a>, Italy’s finest avant-rock/jazz/noise/whatever fusionists, and Matthew Bower’s seminal <a href="/music/Skullflower">Skullflower</a>! Plus Rock-A-Rolla and Last.fm DJ sets!!!


</p>

event.title: Future Brain
event.description:
Future Brain is back from her holidays...

SYNTHESIZER DANCE PARTY!

electronic disco from the past, present and future

ITALO : EURO : HI - NRG : FREESTYLE
ELECTRO : NEW WAVE : SYNTH POP
COSMIC : ROBOTIC : SYSTEMATIC

** with special guest DJs**

event.title: Miles of Smiles Presents: Oren Ambarchi and Helm
event.description:
Doors 8.00pm // £7adv/ £8 door

For more info visit: www.milesofsmiles.co.uk.

Please join the mailing list to be kept informed of future events.


Oren Ambarchi

http://www.orenambarchi.com
Oren Ambarchi is a composer and multi-instrumentalist with longstanding interests in transcending conventional instrumental approaches. His work focuses mainly on the exploration of the guitar, "re-routing the instrument into a zone of alien abstraction where it’s no longer easily identifiable as itself. Instead, it’s a laboratory for extended sonic investigation". (The Wire, UK). Ambarchi's work on harmonics and resonance has led him to define serene spaces of fluid, shifting sound that is both fragile and extremely physical.

He has performed and recorded with a diverse array of artists such as Martin Ng (Australia), Sunn 0)) (USA), Christian Fennesz (Austria), Otomo Yoshihide (Japan), Pimmon (Australia), Keiji Haino (Japan), John Zorn (USA), Rizili (Greece), Voice Crack (Switzerland), Sachiko M (Japan), Keith Rowe (UK), Phill Niblock (USA), Gunter Muller (Switzerland), Evan Parker (UK), Robbie Avenaim (Australia), Toshimaru Nakamura (Japan), Dave Grohl (USA), Damo Suzuki (Japan), Chris Townend (Australia) and many more.

Ambarchi is involved in many collaborative projects including the song-based duo Sun with Chris Townend (releases on Staubgold, Preservation, Textile & Important records), Burial Chamber Trio together with Greg Anderson of Sunn 0))) & Atilla Csihar of Mayhem (with a recent LP release on Southern Lord & an upcoming 10" release) and Grave Temple with Csihar and Stephen O'Malley of Khanate & Sunn 0))).


Helm

http://www.myspace.com/lkyngr
Heavy space-warp drone from Luke Younger of Birds of Delay

event.title: 108 Pieces Demolition
event.description:
A multi-channel sound installation, building-site and live performance set up, investigating concepts of demolition and construction while engaging audience and performer in interaction with physical and acoustic approaches to these concepts. Architecture meets sound art.

Alexander Wendt, Janek Schaefer, Douglas Benford and Jasper Leyland

www.alexanderwendt.com

A rare occasion to gain access to the LABAN, contemporary dance school designed by award-winning architects Herzog & de Meuron.
Families and children welcome.

3 July / 6.30pm / £8, £5 concession

LABAN Creekside, London, SE8 3DZ, Box Office +44 (0)20 8469 9500, www.laban.org
10 min from London Bridge by rail to: Deptford or Greenwich (and a 5 in walk)
or busses: 47, 53, 89, 177, 188, 225

The event is funded by PRS Foundation for new music and part of Live Connections 2008


http://www.last.fm/music/Alexander+Wendt/+videos/8382523

event.title: Oramics: The Life and Works of Daphne Oram
event.description: This concert features unheard music by Daphne Oram, a pioneering British composer and electronic musician who died in 2003. Much of the music heard in this performance has been uncovered while digitising her tapes at Goldsmith's College, London University. Other works, like Sardonica, written with Ivor Walsworth for piano and tape, receive their first performances in decades and special guest artists including Andrea Parker, creator of warm electro music, remix Daphne's soundworld for a new generation, using drawn-sound techniques developed in the 1950s.

<div style="width:338px; clear:both;">

<div class="pre_copy" style="float:left; display:inline; clear:both; width:100%;">


<p><a href="/presents">Last.fm/Presents</a> are very excited to give you one of their most exciting line-ups yet. Appearing exclusively for Last.fm for one night only will be the inventors of Kraut Rock - <a href="/music/Faust">Faust</a>. Key figures in 20th century music, <a href="/music/Faust">Faust</a> are responsible along with <a href="/music/Kraftwerk">Kraftwerk</a> and <a href="/music/CAN">CAN</a> for practically re-inventing music in the early seventies, and influence that can still be found in music of modern-day bands such as <a href="/music/Holy+Fuck">Holy Fuck</a>, <a href="/music/Quiet+Village">Quiet Village</a>, <a href="/music/Animal+Collective">Animal Collective</a> and many more.</p>

<p>With support from <a href="/music/Ulterior">Ulterior</a> and our very own <a href="/music/Last.fm+DJ+Team">Last.fm DJ Team</a> this is gonna be big, get your tickets now!</p>

</div>
</div>

MAP: Google Map for Korsan

http://www.myspace.com/djnaynay

DJ Undecided is part of Paleface's amazing Northern Line Records crew, and he's got some large things coming up like Bassline Showa at Egg and Hype at Mass. We've been listening to his mixes a lot because he's sick!

http://www.myspace.com/djundecided

There's also Alex Carefull, who has a ridiculously good collection of 2-step garage, and

Love's Tru Flavour and

Hard Target

£3 before 11, £5 after
www.myspace.com/londonwifey

BASSLINE/NICHE/4X4/GARAGE/2-STEP

event.title: gay against you
event.description:
Who Needs Drummers?

It’s Saturday night and the first Last.fm Presents of the year is upon us. Somewhere amid the packed room is Lachlann Rattray of Gay Against You. On stage, his normally bespectacled partner-in-crime Joe Howe fears he has lost him forever. “If you’re not me, please sit-down” Lachlann requests (after locating his microphone) in a last ditch attempt to be reunited with his band mate. <a href="http://blog.last.fm/2008/02/20/who-needs-drummers">Read more…</a>

event.title: Olivier Messiaen - Des Canyons aux etoiles
event.description:
Susanna Malkki conductor
Pierre-Laurent Aimard piano
Jean-Christophe Vervoitte horn
Samuel Favre zylophone
Michel Cerutti glockenspiel

This world-leading ensemble opens Southbank Centre's Messiaen festival. 'From the Canyons to the Stars' links the canyons of Utah with the ancient light of the stars. Intended for the bicentennial of the US in 1976, this work provides glimpses back into time and history, flecked with almost unimaginable colour combinations and the sound of exotic bird calls.

event.title: Andrew Weatherall
event.description: It was our final Last.fm party of the year last night, and we all descended on the Bethnal Green Working Men's Club with a view to causing some pre-Christmas carnage.

event.title: STFU
event.description: Of course it's brought to you from us: http://www.no-signal.net

event.title: Spy Versus Spy
event.description: Following on from their re-packaged discography on Gravity, the reformed Spies are playing some shows. Come check out this (fairly legendary) UK guitar band that managed to pull together influences like Braid and Cap'n Jazz into something original. You will not be disappointed.

event.title: Shit and Shine
event.description: Last night was thunderous. By the time <a href="http://www.last.fm/music/Shit+and+Shine">Shit and Shine</a> took over the smallest stage in the world with six their drumkits, bowling was in full effect. The only downside? You just don't get the same auditory satisfaction with a ten-pin strike when you're up against six drummers and four DJs. <a href="http://blog.last.fm/2007/11/30/crash-smash-strike">Read more…</a>

event.title: KOMPAKT
event.description:
Following September's album launch party for the mighty SUPERMAYER which saw Plastic People shaken to it's foundations by Michael Mayer and Superpitcher with a killer set of influences and inspirations of their epochal new record 'Save The World'


For November, we bring you a rare live set from THE ORB's Thomas Fehlmann, a master of deep, lush organic techno and ambient sounds, and a true legend within electronic music. Accompanying him will be a dj set from KOMPAKT'S very own disco prince Justus Kohncke... expect a hedonistic set of juicy disco classics, sleek grooves and perhaps some pop classics! allez-allez djs Sam & Steve, will warms things up with their (un)usual selection of krautrock / ambient / deep grooves ..

9-2
£7 adv/on the door

tickets available here:
http://www.wegottickets.com/event/23275

event.title: Atlantic Waves 2007: Grain of Sound Night
event.description:
● Richard Chartier, Sawako, Shinjiro Yamaguchi, João Silva [world premiere]
● Terre Thaemlitz, Manuel Mota, Jonas Olesen, Stilb [world premiere]
● Tim Hecker, Safe & Sound, M0rph3u [world premiere]

Curated by Portuguese record label Grain of Sound, a night of electronic soundscapes and mind stimulating visuals. Innovative collaborations between sound artists Richard Chartier (USA), Sawako (Japan/USA), Shinjiro Yamaguchi (Japan), and video artist João Silva (Portugal); Terre Thaemlitz (USA/Japan), Stilb (Portugal), Jonas Olesen (Denmark) and guitarist Manuel Mota (Portugal); and Tim Hecker (Canada) with Safe and Sound (Portugal) and visual artist M0rph3u (Portugal). In association with The Wire 25, The Wire magazine's 25th birthday season.
